title: Brazoria County Sheriff Office - Officer Johnny Cagle's Employee File

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Brazoria County Sheriff Office - Officer Johnny Cagle's Employee File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Please provide ANY and ALL documents, files, photographs in the Employee File of: Officer Johnny Cagle.

2) A copy of any and all complaint(s) received for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

3) A copy of any and all Internal Affairs Report(s) and or Finding(s) for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

4) A copy of any and all Disciplinary Record(s) for the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

5) A copy of any termination paperwork, or letter of resignation from the following officer: Officer Johnny Cagle.

Excluded from this request:

a) Confidential information deemed protected by law, statute or Attorney General Ruling.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

title: Expense reports from Mayor Eric Adams Oct. 2023 trip to Mexico, Ecuador and Colombia

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Expense reports from Mayor Eric Adams Oct. 2023 trip to Mexico, Ecuador and Colombia
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All expense reports from Mayor Eric Adams Oct. 2023 trip to Mexico, Ecuador and Colombia. The records should include the date, description and amount of all expenses reported by the mayor and his team.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: UW CoMotion documentation of PRA procedures
communications.communication:
Hi UW Office of Public Records and Open Public Meetings,

UW CoMotion's FAQ at https://comotion.uw.edu/services/faqs/ says "the university has processes in place to ensure that information released under a [Washington Public Records Act] request and [sic] does not compromise the licensee’s competitiveness."

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request all written documentation relating to the general implementation and execution of these processes, excluding any documentation specific to any individual innovation or stakeholder.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Between the very beginning of March 1st, 2020, to the very end of March 5th, 2020:

The following, that are explicitly listed as available in the executive chamber data dictionary:
briefings, research, analyses, resource material, opinions, recommendations, reports, and correspondence, State Operations Directives, Governor’s Correspondence, Lieutenant Governor’s Correspondence.

As well as the following, should they be available, emails and other communications that are searchable but not otherwise included above.

This records search shall only include records pertaining to, created by, or mentioning, the following employees:
Melissa deRosa
Beth Garvey
Kelly Cummings
Abigail Barker
Dana Carotenuto
Stephanie Benton
Rich Azzopardi
Dani Lever
Jill DesRosiers
Peter Ajemian
Larry Schwartz
Thomas Feeney
Matthew Saal

As well as the following individuals who were identified in press conferences as special advisors or otherwise part of "the team", where records may exist from their interactions with the chamber and role as advisors:
Robert Mujica
Jim Malatras (SUNY)
Sherlita Amler, Westchester commissioner of public health
LAWRENCE E. EISENSTEIN, MD, MPH, FACP, Nassau county Commissioner of Health
Dr. Gregson H. Pigott, Suffolk county health Commissioner

Should that be too broad of a search, I request that you further narrow the search to only records pertaining to the then-beginning outbreak, which may have been referred to by many names, including:

"SARS", "SARS-COV-2", "SARS-nCOV-2019", "Coronavirus", "COVID", "COVID-19", "Wuhan Coronavirus", "Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome", "2019-nCoV", "the virus", also, terms I would never personally use to describe it, like "Wuhan flu", "Chinese virus", or similar.

And/or including the terms:
"Respirator", "airborne", "aerosol", "n95", "filter", "ventilation", "precautionary", and "HVAC".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ALEXANDER RICCIO

title: Terrorist Screening Center Audit Reports

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of Targeted Justice Inc.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to Targeted Justice:
    1. All Office of Inspector General’s audit reports of the Terrorist Screening Center from the year 2007 to the present.
    2. Federal Bureau of Investigation and Terrorist Screening Center emails, letters, replies, objections other document filed or sent in reaction to the Office of Inspector General’s audit reports since 2007.
    3. Documents regarding administrative or judicial enforcement action to bring agency into compliance with regulations, the constitution and the law.
    4. Complaints made to the Office of Inspector General since 2007 regarding the Terrorist Screening Center Operations. 
        
The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or any other format where the information sought may be stored.
As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).
Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).
Request for expedited processing
Targeted Justice currently has over 9,000 subscribers and over 115,000 thousands views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.
Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.
Request for Fee Waiver
Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).
Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).
For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.
If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 832-247-3046. Thank you for your consideration of my request.
Sincerely,

Ana L. Toledo, Esq.	
Targeted Justice, Inc.
P.O. Box 15990
Houston, TX  77220

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

title: Law enforcement informal and formal settlement data and reports

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Law enforcement informal and formal settlement data and reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Materials related to and sufficient to show all instances of alleged and actual inappropriate or illegal behavior or actions resulting in compensation or expenditures involving this agency.

Responsive materials include records of all settlements (formal and informal) and payments to which this agency was or is a party for the period from January 1, 2010 through the date this request is processed. Responsive materials include those for matters and legal claims resolved prior to the initiation of any litigation.

In particular, materials responsive to this request include all reports, lists, databases, spreadsheets, and other documentation detailing incidents of legal claims or other allegations requiring compensation for claimants, attorneys, or any other party.

If spreadsheets or similar documents are available in response to this request, please provide all segregable data, including but not limited to:

The nature of the claim or legal matter
The claimant and other parties involved
The relevant case and tracking numbers for court and internal systems
The date the lawsuit was served or litigation commenced
The final disposition or current status of the case, including whether a case is still pending
The amount spent to date as a result of the legal engagement
The amount paid to any parties related to the legal claim, including any city payout and any non-monetary compensation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P155025-100423
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P155025-100423. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments during the COVID-19 Pandemic. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.  
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P155025-100423. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-P155025-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Land Use Code Update 2014-Present + Land Use Code and
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All external and internal documents, emails, minutes and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2014 to present regarding the  Land Use Code re-write and proposal. Including but not limited to internal and external emails regarding the Land Use Code re-write, interaction with Kendig Keast Collaborative, City Council meetings, City Council workshops, Planning & Zoning Commission meetings, special or joint meetings, Planning & Zoning workshops, Citizen Advisory Committee meetings or any other meetings that were held in regards to the Land Use Code re-write.

<^^^>This is included because this request was done by someone anonymously three years ago, it has been ignored for three years, I ran across it, and if you need a name... well, you've got mine now. Add any contact reports or messages to that above request, such as phone logs, activity logs, journal entries, electronic calendars, text messages, or other metadata from cell phone text messages. These should be prioritized in order of release fastest to longest term, not held until all documentation is in, and sent / priced accordingly. In other words, if it's easier to aggregate and price and send one of the items first, then price and send it separately rather than wait for the entire package to be sent at one time.

2.    I also want all external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2019 to present regarding the assignment of persons to the Zoning Administrator position (referred to as 6.24 in the Cortez code)also to include hiring criteria, job descriptions, job description changes, compensation descriptions, internal memos between staff about candidates for positions, the candidates for those positions who did not get hired, contract planners. Ref to 6.24 "Administrative officials.
(a)	Zoning Administrator. There is created an official administrative position known as the zoning administrator. The zoning administrator shall be the city planner and shall be appointed by, directed by, and serve at the pleasure of the city manager, except in such cases as noted in Section 2.02 of this code..." Additionally, please generate a document citing who held the position and at what times for the 6.24 Zoning Administrator. 

3.   All external and internal documents, emails, minutes and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2018 to present regarding the members past and present of the Parks, Recreation, and Forestry Advisory Board members, internal and external emails, to include private email inbound or outbound that is still subject to the Colorado Open Records Act but deliberately or inadvertently containing official business. 

4. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Matthew Keefauver from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board. Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: matthewkeefauver@aim.com

5. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Teri Paul from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board, or emailing or interacting to anyone within City of Cortez. Teri Paul is a member of the Advisory Board of Parks, Recreation, & Forestry currently. Include emails which have been forwarded, originated from or were addressed or cc'd to: sundog2014@yahoo.com

6. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Of David Rainey from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board. Include emails which have been forwarded, originated from or were addressed or cc'd to his personal email: dnrainey@mac.com

7. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Robert Dobry from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board. Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: robert.dobry@gmail.com

8. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Creighton Wright from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board. All job description, interview notes, discussion between members prior to Creighton Wright or during his time, by other staff of City of Cortez or other advisory members of the community, or councilmembers.

9.  All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Lance McDaniel / Lance McDaniels from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board. 

10.  All external and internal documents, emails, minutes and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2018 to present regarding the members past and present of the Planning and Zoning Board members, internal and external emails, to include private email inbound or outbound that is still subject to the Colorado Open Records Act but deliberately or inadvertently containing official business. All job description, interview notes, discussion between members or by other staff of City of Cortez or other advisory members of the community, or councilmembers.

11. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers of Rachael Marchbanks from the beginning of time (or January 1, 2000) operating in any capacity within the government, or serving on any advisory board, or emailing or interacting to anyone within City of Cortez. Rachel Marchbanks is the Community and Economic Development Director. Please include correspondence from her private email: publisher@tribalcollegejournal.org or rachaelmarchbanks@yahoo.com inbound to discuss business with any council or staff. All job description documentation for this position as well as discussion of staff or council is to be included, and private emails still subject to the Colorado Open Records Act deliberately or inadvertently containing official business.

12. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes that reply to carpenter81321@protonmail.com or contain the text 'Zu Gallery' from any staff, council, or otherwise are subject to the Colorado Open Records Act.

13. Any web traffic, itemized and aggregated by user identity to include the real name of the domain users that posted from within the server domain of the City of Cortez that posted replies or reactions to facebook since 2018, particularly relating to facebook.com/carpenter81321 in 2023. 

14. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes that pertain to temporary status or permanent employee assignment as handling zoning and compliance issues as temporary duty. 

15.  All external and internal documents, emails, minutes that pertain to PZ 772-2023 for ILC. 

16. All external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers and video/audio recordings that pertain to Police report call #23017731 on Saturday at or around 3:41pm 4/29/2023 originated by Rachael Marchbanks, and any discussions between staff or council regarding this event. Any other city to police department staff interactions from within the Planning and Zoning enforcement or Director Marchbanks since 2020.

These should be prioritized in order of release fastest to longest term, not held until all documentation is in, and sent / priced accordingly. In other words, if it's easier to send one of the items first, then price and send it or others separately rather than wait for the entire package to be sent. Please price according to each item if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: Request for report on "COVID-19 wastewater Testing Program"

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for report on "COVID-19 wastewater Testing Program"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

As per Local Law 28 0f 2021 Of the City of New York, I request you to provide me the following document:-
The most recent report on the COVID-19 wastewater Testing Program which is required to be submitted to the Mayor and the Speaker of the Council by August 31 of each year and should provide information on the following particulars:-

1. Results of sampling, disaggregated by the site where the sample was collected, date sample
was collected, and date sample was tested, in order to monitor the leading indicators of increases
or decreases in COVID-19 presence in each drainage area throughout the study;
2. The total cost of such pilot program;
3. Analysis of the effectiveness of the pilot program in testing for SARS-CoV-2;
4. A plan for weekly testing at each city wastewater treatment plant if the commissioner of
health and mental hygiene or state commissioner of health declares that the incidence of
SARS-CoV-2 is appropriate for such action or if the centers for disease control and prevention
issues a SARS-CoV-2 pandemic declaration.

I request the report to be made available in an electronically accessible format and it should pertain to the "COVID-19 wastewater Testing Program"

title: Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka (FBI)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI Files on Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka, founder of the internet forum "Something Awful." 

I have attached proof of death. 

As per my understanding of the FBI's FOIA policies, please expand your search to include both main and reference files.

I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written extensively about government transparency, including several books on the FBI specifically. As such, I am not requesting a fee waiver, but I am requesting I be placed in the media requester category.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JPat Brown

title: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2021 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2021 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Department of Defense, inclusive of all branches of the military, has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2021. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports.  I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: KORA Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting a Kentucky Open Records Act (KORA) request seeking access to specific documents related to your department's activities for the two-month period preceding today, from August 3, 2023, to October 3, 2023. Specifically, I am requesting:

1. All records of KORA requests sent to your department during the specified two-month period.
2. All records of KORA responses issued by your department in response to external requests within the same timeframe.
3. A copy of the fee schedule for processing KORA requests and any associated costs.
4. A copy of your department's open records policy for reference.
5.Correspondence in relationship to KORA requests sent between government entities.

Please include details such as dates, requestors' names, and request contents in the KORA records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Louisiana Public Records Act Request: Louisiana Parish Prison Visitation, Telephone, Video Policies/Reports (Jefferson Parish Sheriff)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana Public Records Act Request: Louisiana Parish Prison Visitation, Telephone, Video Policies/Reports (Jefferson Parish Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, or equivalent guiding materials regarding the visitation of individuals not in custody of this agency.

2. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, or equivalent guiding materials regarding the use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other telecommunications and electronic communication by individuals in the custody of this agency.

3. Any and all open or active bidding or Requests for Proposal regarding the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services.

4. Any and all active contracts regarding the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services. Please include all associated supplemental materials, including any and all attachments and exhibits. Please provide any other materials regarding the terms of service.

5. Any and all financial reports or invoices related to the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services. Please include all usage, commission, and fee reports, providing as much segregable data as possible.

6. All communications for the period from  December 1, 2022 through May 1, 2023 between this agency or any representative thereof and any prison telecommunications company or organization, including but not limited to Securus Technologies, Inc. and its subsidiary JPay.

7. All communications for the period from  December 1, 2022 through May 1, 2023 between this agency or any representative thereof and any representative of the Louisiana Public Service Commission.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Reagan Ross

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P013291-100323
communications.communication:
Dear Christa Miller: The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/  The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt.  Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 10/3/2023 and given the reference number P013291-100323 for tracking purposes.

title: FBI: Katharine Sergava

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Katharine Sergava
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records mentioning or pertaining to the dancer and actress KATHARINE SERGAVA (aka KATHARINE SERGAVA SZNYCER aka KATHRYN SERGAVA). SERGAVA was born on July 30 1910 in Tbilisi, Georgia and died on November 26th of 2005 in New York City.  

https://www.nytimes.com/2003/12/04/arts/katharine-sergava-the-star-of-oklahoma-ballet-dies.html

Proof of death is not necessary as her death was widely reported in the media. Of particular interest would include, but not be limited to: bureau records related to her work with the United Service Organizations or any correspondence between SERGAVA and director Hoover. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Katharine Sergava. 

Please include a survey of records at the Miami field office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Sergava.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Documents, emails and reports related to the Cambridge Public Library's "Outdoor Story Time with Drag Kings, Queens and Friends" on June 4, 2022 (Cambridge Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All recordings, including but not limited to, correspondence, reports, or analysis of public safety threats to the Cambridge Public Library's  "Outdoor Story Time with Drag Kings, Queens and Friends" that occurred on June 4, 2022 and records of any police detail assigned to the event.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Saul Tannenbaum
